From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2021 Indian film


Hum Bhi Akele Tum Bhi AkeleOfficial posterDirected byHarish VyasWritten bySusan FernandesHarish VyasProduced byFirst Ray FilmsStarringZareen KhanAnshuman JhaCinematographyFaroukh MistryRakesh RawatEdited bySuresh PaiMusic byOni-AdilProductioncompanyFirst Ray FilmsDistributed byHotstarRelease date
9 May 2021 (2021-05-09)
Running time117 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Hum Bhi Akele Tum Bhi Akele (transl. We both are alone) is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language film written and directed by Harish Vyas and produced under the banner of First Ray Films.[1] The film stars Anshuman Jha, Zareen Khan along with Ravi Khanvilkar, Gurfateh Pirzada and Nitin Sharma in supporting roles.[2][3][4] The film was released on 9 May 2021 on Hotstar.[5] It received generally mixed reviews, with praise for its performances and LGBT themes, but criticism for its screenplay and second half.


Plot[edit]
The film explores friendship between Veer Pratap Randhawa, a gay man and Mansi Dubey, a lesbian woman on a road trip.[1][6]

Cast[edit]
Zareen Khan as Mansi Dubey[7]
Anshuman Jha as Veer Pratap Randhawa[8]
Ravi Khanvilkar as Mr Dubey
Gurfateh Pirzada as Akshay Mittal
Nitin Sharma as Ashar
Jahnvi Rawat as Nikki Tsong
Denzil Smith as MLA Tsong
Production[edit]
The principal photography of the film started in mid-June 2019.[9][10]

Release[edit]
The film had its World Premiere at the HBO South Asian International Film Festival & had a successful festival run.[11] Originally the film was scheduled for theatrical release in March 2020 but due to pandemic it observed delays in release and finally the film was released on 9 May 2021 on Hotstar.[12]

Soundtrack[edit]
Hum Bhi Akele Tum Bhi AkeleSoundtrack album by Oni-AdilReleased5 May 2021[13]Recorded2020GenreFeature film soundtrackLength22:36LanguageHindiLabelZee Music CompanyOfficial audioHum Bhi Akele Tum Bhi Akele - Full Album on YouTube

The film's music was composed by Oni-Adil while lyrics written by Bulleh Shah, Sourabh Negi and Pratyush Prakash.

Track listingNo.TitleLyricsSinger(s)Length1."Bullah Ki Jaana"Bulleh ShahAdil Rasheed4:162."Mashhoor Hai Tu"Sourabh NegiAdil Rasheed3:593."Nazdeekiyan"Sourabh NegiAdil Rasheed4:484."Hai Nahin"Pratyush PrakashAdil Rasheed3:405."Nazdeekiyan" (Female version)Sourabh NegiParul Mishra5:23Total length:22:36
Reception[edit]
Sana Farzeen of The Indian Express wrote: "Hum Bhi Akele Tum Bhi Akele started on a promising note. However, it soon faltered with the makers wanting to add too many twists to the tale."[14] Udita Jhunjhunwala in her review for Firstpost rated the film 2/5 and appreciated the performances of Khan and Zha but criticized its slow narration. "Hum Bhi Akele Tum Bhi Akele has some freshness, but its the mawkish climax that rids the story of any realism," Jhunjhunwala added.[15]
Cinema Express critic Shilajit Mitra, who also rated the film 2/5, stated: "The film is pleasantly shot, in sync with its chilled-out score, but its need to verbalise everything ruins all intimacy."[16]
